class ingest_office.OfficeIngester(client_id: str, client_secret: str, tenant_id: str, site_id: str, user_email: str, download_dir: str, batch_size: int = 10)[source]

Bases: object

__init__(client_id: str, client_secret: str, tenant_id: str, site_id: str, user_email: str, download_dir: str, batch_size: int = 10) → None[source]

Initialize the OfficeIngester with necessary credentials and configurations.

Parameters:

  • client_id – The client ID of the Azure AD app.

  • client_secret – The client secret of the Azure AD app.

  • tenant_id – The tenant ID of the Azure AD app.

  • site_id – The ID of the SharePoint site.

  • user_email – The email of the user whose contributions to search for.

  • download_dir – The directory to download and save the documents.

  • batch_size – The number of documents to process in each batch.

get_access_token() → str[source]

Obtain an access token from Azure AD.

Returns:

Access token as a string.

Raises:

Exception – If the access token cannot be obtained.

list_sharepoint_documents() → Dict[str, Any][source]

List documents in the SharePoint site.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the list of documents.

get_document_versions(item_id: str) → Dict[str, Any][source]

Get versions of a specific document.

Parameters:

item_id – The ID of the document.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the versions of the document.

filter_documents_by_user(drive_items: Dict[str, Any]) → List[Dict[str, Any]][source]

Filter documents by the specified user.

Parameters:

drive_items – A dictionary containing the list of documents.

Returns:

A list of filtered documents.

download_document(file_id: str) → bytes[source]

Download a document from SharePoint.

Parameters:

file_id – The ID of the document to download.

Returns:

The content of the document as bytes.

Extract text from a DOCX file.

Parameters:

file_path – The path to the DOCX file.

Returns:

Extracted text as a string.

Extract images from a DOCX file.

Parameters:

file_path – The path to the DOCX file.

Returns:

A list of paths to the extracted images.

extract_table_from_xlsx(file_path: str) → List[Dict[str, List[List[Any]]]][source]

Extract tables from an XLSX file.

Parameters:

file_path – The path to the XLSX file.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries containing table data.

process_batch(documents: List[Dict[str, Any]]) → List[Dict[str, Any]][source]

Process a batch of documents.

Parameters:

documents – A list of documents to process.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries containing document metadata and content.

run() → None[source]

Run the OfficeIngester to download and process documents from SharePoint.

class ingest_slack.SlackIngestor(client_id: str, client_secret: str, refresh_token: str, output_dir: str, max_messages_per_file: int)[source]

Bases: object

__init__(client_id: str, client_secret: str, refresh_token: str, output_dir: str, max_messages_per_file: int)[source]

Initialize the SlackIngestor with necessary credentials and configurations.

Parameters:

  • client_id (str) – Slack Client ID.

  • client_secret (str) – Slack Client Secret.

  • refresh_token (str) – Slack Refresh Token.

  • output_dir (str) – Output directory for saved messages.

  • max_messages_per_file (int) – Maximum number of messages per file.

refresh_access_token() → None[source]

Refresh the Slack access token using the provided client ID, client secret, and refresh token.

Fetch the list of conversations (channels) from Slack.

Returns:

List of conversations.

Return type:

List[Dict]

Parameters:

channel_id (str) – ID of the Slack channel.

Returns:

List of messages.

Return type:

Download a file from a URL and encode it in base64.

Parameters:

file_url (str) – URL of the file to download.

Returns:

Base64 encoded file content, or None if the download failed.

Return type:

Optional[str]

Save a list of messages to a JSON file.

Parameters:

  • messages (List[Dict]) – List of messages to save.

  • file_index (int) – Index of the file (used in the filename).

ingest() → None[source]

Main function to download Slack messages and files, and save them to JSON files.

class ingest_repo.GitLabIngestor(gitlab_token: str, local_repo_base_path: str, output_base_path: str, batch_size: int = 100)[source]

Bases: object

__init__(gitlab_token: str, local_repo_base_path: str, output_base_path: str, batch_size: int = 100) → None[source]

Initialize the GitLabIngestor with necessary parameters.

Parameters:

  • gitlab_token (str) – GitLab personal access token.

  • local_repo_base_path (str) – Local base path to store repositories.

  • output_base_path (str) – Base path to store output JSON files.

  • batch_size (int, optional) – Number of commits per JSON file. Defaults to 100.

process_repository(repo_url: str) → None[source]

Process a single GitLab repository and export its commits to JSON files.

Parameters:

repo_url (str) – URL of the GitLab repository.

_export_batch(output_repo_path: str, branch_name: str, batch: List[Dict[str, Any]], batch_index: int) → None[source]

Export a batch of commits to a JSON file.

Parameters:

  • output_repo_path (str) – Path to store the output JSON files.

  • branch_name (str) – Name of the branch.

  • batch (List[Dict[str, Any]]) – List of commit data.

  • batch_index (int) – Index of the batch.

process_repositories(repo_urls: List[str]) → None[source]

Process multiple GitLab repositories.

Parameters:

repo_urls (List[str]) – List of GitLab repository URLs.

ingest_repo.main() → None[source]

Main function to parse arguments and initiate the GitLabIngestor.
